posts.title: There is massive panic in the university system and academia at the moment.
posts.content:
I have worked in public universities doing biomedical research for over 20 years. I chose to because I want to share my work freely and advance medicine. Recently, universities have spiraled out of control, mostly so in the last few years, but it has been a long process and it looks like something major is happening this week.

The NIH has canceled all study sessions for grants.

To people outside of the field this means that the grant funding source is gone. The study sessions were where people would submit grants to for various projects such as HIV or cancer biology. As of Friday, all grant applications appear to be in limbo and the faculty at universities are in a panic. Normally, something like this would have drawn ire and outrage from me, but a purge in the university system is absolutely needed. I will try to briefly summarize below.

Bloat and waste. The amount of overhead and spending on technology that is not needed is insane. Questions that can be answered cheaply are often over engineered. The lack of respect for this technology is also present, with carelessness and lack of maintenance costing tax payers millions. Just off the top of my head a graduate student destroyed a $25,000 rotor because they didn't balance their samples and no one seemed to care. No disciplinary action.

Worthless studies. The amount of projects that have no practical application or even provide any new information is insane. People will spend 2.4 million dollars and 4 years characterizing a pathogen that everyone has and only causes disease in a few stage 4 AIDs patients to come to the conclusion that the immune system is weakened or 1.2 million to show you can detect viral antigen in asymptomatic flu patents for up to 4 weeks. Just two recent examples of things published in high end journals that provide nothing.

American universities aren't American anymore. Culturally and ethnically they do not hold American values. Especially during covid, I was constantly reminding faculty that America has free speech and it is illegal and we hung Nazis for forced medical procedures. The factually is full of a lot of forgein at the top levels, mostly Chinese and Indian nationals. Additionally the Chinese PI has Chinese staff, the Indian PI has Indian staff, and the American PI has 50% Chinese and Indian staff. Then throw on DEI on top of it. I have seen a hiring committee chose a 26 year old fresh graduate diversity hire over a white male with 10 years experience to run a major 300 person lecture course because of her "lived experience" of not being white I guess. I then roll my eyes when older PIs complain that the students cannot do basic calculus or simple Pka acid-base equations.

Either way sorry for the long rant. I wanted to convey the panic and how bad things are at universities right now. They are holding meetings and spamming emails. Everyone is in a panic and at this point I hope the system gets purged. They are so entitled too, I have to constantly remind people that we work for the taxpayer and we work at their discretion.

Keep an eye on this news this week, I suspect something big will drop early this week regarding public research.

I have worked in public universities doing biomedical research for over 20 years. I chose to because I want to share my work freely and advance medicine. Recently, universities have spiraled out of control, mostly so in the last few years, but it has been a long process and it looks like something major is happening this week. 

**The NIH has canceled all study sessions for grants.**

To people outside of the field this means that the grant funding source is gone. The study sessions were where people would submit grants to for various projects such as HIV or cancer biology. As of Friday, all grant applications appear to be in limbo and the faculty at universities are in a panic. Normally, something like this would have drawn ire and outrage from me, but a purge in the university system is absolutely needed. I will try to briefly summarize below.

Bloat and waste. The amount of overhead and spending on technology that is not needed is insane. Questions that can be answered cheaply are often over engineered. The lack of respect for this technology is also present, with carelessness and lack of maintenance costing tax payers millions. Just off the top of my head a graduate student destroyed a $25,000 rotor because they didn't balance their samples and no one seemed to care. No disciplinary action.

Worthless studies. The amount of projects that have no practical application or even provide any new information is insane. People will spend 2.4 million dollars and 4 years characterizing a pathogen that everyone has and only causes disease in a few stage 4 AIDs patients to come to the conclusion that the immune system is weakened or 1.2 million to show you can detect viral antigen in asymptomatic flu patents for up to 4 weeks. Just two recent examples of things published in high end journals that provide nothing. 

American universities aren't American anymore. Culturally and ethnically they do not hold American values. Especially during covid, I was constantly reminding faculty that America has free speech and it is illegal and we hung Nazis for forced medical procedures. The factually is full of a lot of forgein at the top levels, mostly Chinese and Indian nationals. Additionally the Chinese PI has Chinese staff, the Indian PI has Indian staff, and the American PI has 50% Chinese and Indian staff. Then throw on DEI on top of it. I have seen a hiring committee chose a 26 year old fresh graduate diversity hire over a white male with 10 years experience to run a major 300 person lecture course because of her "lived experience" of not being white I guess. posts.title: Astronomers announce discovery of new asteroid. The elite Minor Planet Center organization, located at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, then gave the object an official name: “2018 CN41” & declared it could hit the Earth. It was Musk's Red Tesla sports car launched in 2018.
